Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery plate. On top of slipped rim stopt maeander to left framed by bands; bowl glazed as far as preserved. On unslipped(?) exterior, dark bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit notes 'for the ornament compare Naukratis I: pl. 7, figs. 1-3'.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 29, no. 105, pl. 28)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.697)
